Judul: STRATEGIES TO SUSTAIN LOW COST LOGISTICS OPERATION IN PT. INDONESIA EPSON INDUSTRY
Abstrak:
In current business environment, every company is facing competition from global market. It is an era where every company needs to accurately grasp present opportunities and to scientifically and steadily step forward to achieve the its vision and mission.  
 

In Epson Production Standard, whatever the position, it is always necessary to combine it with what is called mental backbone or sense of value. It is necessary for each department to own the skill of feeling and acting on its own through its ceaseless creation and challenges to achieve the best QCD in the industry.  
 

QCD stands for Quality, Costs, and Delivery. Quality has to be maintained to satisfy customers, while in the same time, costs such as losses and wastes have to be eliminated. Next is the company should only deliver the right things at the right time and right quantity.  
 

In Parts Logistic department of PT. Indonesia Epson Industry (IEI), goals and targets should be linked with the company and business goals and set in the detailed actual cost, added value and the amount of stock reduction, etc.  
 

Parts logistics department task is supporting the production site in term of delivery by supplying the right parts at the right time and right quantity; it means that there will be guarantee of no stop time due to parts shortages or delivery mistake, no excess delivery and etc. By achieving the optimal delivery, the cost of losses and waste can be eliminated as well.  
 

From April 2005 to September 2008 there were many stop time due to parts shortages. As the role of Parts Logistic department is managing the delivery and storage of parts, thus its mission is to lower those parts shortages by providing the tools for analyzing and grasping problems to find out the effective and efficient solution.  
 

The purpose of this thesis is to provide the strategy implementation of improvement activity that is inline with IEI business aims. Since October 2008, the activity was started using the 4P‟s (Philosophy, Process, People/ Partner and Problem Solving) model introduced by the Toyota Way, and the starting point of activity was implementation of 5S activity which is combined it with PDCA (Plan, Do, Check, Action) concept. Following up the problem arise, the activity continues to re-establish the procedure related to kanban system and its data base, and then improves the manpower productivity as well as all of process in parts logistic.  
 

Finally, the implementation of those activities is the effective and efficient solution and guarantee to be sustained for long term run proved by no recurrent problem happen. Hopefully it becomes the best contribution for the company.
